rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: الٓمٓ
rows.translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
rows.transliteration: alif lām mīm

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ لَا رَيْبَ ۛ فِيهِ ۛ هُدًى لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: This is the Book, there is no doubt in it, a guidance to the Godwary,
rows.transliteration: dhālikal kitābu lā rayb ۛ fīh ۛ hudan lil-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَيُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
rows.translation: who believe in the Unseen, maintain the prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them;
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yu-minūna bil ghaybi wayuqīmūnaṣ ṣalāta wa mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ مِن قَبْلِكَ وَبِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
rows.translation: and who believe in what has been sent down to you and what was sent down before you, and are certain of the Hereafter.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yu-minūna bimā unzila ilayka wa mā unzila min qablika wabil-ākhirati hum yūqinūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَلَىٰ هُدًى مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Those follow their Lord’s guidance and it is they who are the felicitous.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika `alā hudan min rabbihim ۖ wa-ulā-ika humul mufliḥūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَأَنذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: As for the faithless, it is the same to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not have faith.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū sawā-un `alayhim a-andhartahum am lam tundhirhum lā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: خَتَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَعَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِمْ ۖ وَعَلَىٰٓ أَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ غِشَـٰوَةٌ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Allah has set a seal on their hearts and their hearing, and there is a blindfold on their sight, and there is a great punishment for them.
rows.transliteration: khatamallāhu `alā qulūbihim wa`alā sam`ihim ۖ wa`alā abṣārihim ghishāwah ۖ walahum `adhābun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَبِٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَمَا هُم بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Among the people are those who say, ‘We have faith in Allah and the Last Day,’ but they have no faith.
rows.transliteration: wa minan nāsi man yaqūlu āmannā billāhi wabil yawmil-ākhiri wa mā hum bimu-minīn

rows.arabic: يُخَـٰدِعُونَ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَمَا يَخْدَعُونَ إِلَّآ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: They seek to deceive Allah and those who have faith, yet they deceive no one but themselves, but they are not aware.
rows.transliteration: yukhādi`ūnallāha wal ladhīna āmanū wa mā yakhda`ūna illā anfusahum wa mā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ فَزَادَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ مَرَضًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْذِبُونَ
rows.translation: There is a sickness in their hearts; then Allah increased their sickness, and there is a painful punishment for them because of the lies they used to tell.
rows.transliteration: fī qulūbihim maraḍun fazādahumullāhu maraḍā ۖ walahum `adhābun alīmun bimā kānū yakdhibūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا تُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ مُصْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: When they are told, ‘Do not cause corruption on the earth,’ they say, ‘We are only reformers!’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā qīla lahum lā tufsidū fil-arḍi qālū innamā naḥnu muṣliḥūn

rows.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْسِدُونَ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Behold! They are themselves the agents of corruption, but they are not aware.
rows.transliteration: alā innahum humul mufsidūna walākin lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ ءَامِنُوا۟ كَمَآ ءَامَنَ ٱلنَّاسُ قَالُوٓا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ كَمَآ ءَامَنَ ٱلسُّفَهَآءُ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ ٱلسُّفَهَآءُ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And when they are told, ‘Believe like the people who have believed,’ they say, ‘Shall we believe like the fools who have believed?’ Behold! They are themselves the fools, but they do not know.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā qīla lahum āminū kamā āmanan nāsu qālū anu-minu kamā āmanas sufahā-u ۗ alā innahum humus sufahā-u walākin lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا لَقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ شَيَـٰطِينِهِمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ مُسْتَهْزِءُونَ
rows.translation: When they meet the faithful, they say, ‘We believe,’ but when they are alone with their devils, they say, ‘We are with you; we were only deriding [them].’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā laqul ladhīna āmanū qālū āmannā wa idhā khalaw ilā shayāṭīnihim qālū innā ma`akum innamā naḥnu mustahzi-ūn

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَهْزِئُ بِهِمْ وَيَمُدُّهُمْ فِى طُغْيَـٰنِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
rows.translation: It is Allah who derides them, and leaves them bewildered in their rebellion.
rows.transliteration: allāhu yastahzi-u bihim wayamudduhum fī ṭughyānihim ya`mahūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱشْتَرَوُا۟ ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةَ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ فَمَا رَبِحَت تِّجَـٰرَتُهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُهْتَدِينَ
rows.translation: They are the ones who bought error for guidance, so their trade did not profit them, nor were they guided.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīnash-tarawuḍ ḍalālata bil hudā famā rabiḥat tijāratuhum wa mā kānū muhtadīn

rows.arabic: مَثَلُهُمْ كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِى ٱسْتَوْقَدَ نَارًا فَلَمَّآ أَضَآءَتْ مَا حَوْلَهُۥ ذَهَبَ ٱللَّهُ بِنُورِهِمْ وَتَرَكَهُمْ فِى ظُلُمَـٰتٍ لَّا يُبْصِرُونَ
rows.translation: Their parable is that of one who lighted a torch, and when it had lit up all around him, Allah took away their light, and left them sightless in a manifold darkness.
rows.transliteration: mathaluhum kamathalil ladhis-tawqada nāran falammā aḍā-at mā ḥawlahu dhahaballāhu binūrihim watarakahum fī ẓulumātin lā yubṣirūn

rows.arabic: صُمٌّۢ بُكْمٌ عُمْىٌ فَهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
rows.translation: Deaf, dumb, and blind, they will not come back.
rows.transliteration: ṣummun bukmun `umyun fahum lā yarji`ūn

rows.arabic: أَوْ كَصَيِّبٍ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فِيهِ ظُلُمَـٰتٌ وَرَعْدٌ وَبَرْقٌ يَجْعَلُونَ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِم مِّنَ ٱلصَّوَٰعِقِ حَذَرَ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ مُحِيطٌۢ بِٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Or that of a rainstorm from the sky, wherein is darkness, thunder and lightning: they put their fingers in their ears due to the thunderclaps, apprehensive of death; and Allah besieges the faithless.
rows.transliteration: aw kaṣayyibin minas samā-i fīhi ẓulumātun wara`dun wabarqun yaj`alūna aṣābi`ahum fī ādhānihim minaṣ ṣawā`iqi ḥadharal mawt ۚ wallāhu muḥīṭun bil kāfirīn

rows.arabic: يَكَادُ ٱلْبَرْقُ يَخْطَفُ أَبْصَـٰرَهُمْ ۖ كُلَّمَآ أَضَآءَ لَهُم مَّشَوْا۟ فِيهِ وَإِذَآ أَظْلَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ قَامُوا۟ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَذَهَبَ بِسَمْعِهِمْ وَأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: The lightning almost snatches away their sight: whenever it shines for them, they walk in it, and when the darkness falls upon them, they stand. Had Allah willed, He would have taken away their hearing and sight. Indeed Allah has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: yakādul barqu yakhṭafu abṣārahum ۖ kullamā aḍā-a lahum mashaw fīhi wa idhā aẓlama `alayhim qāmū ۚ walaw shā-allāhu ladhahaba bisam`ihim wa-abṣārihim ۚ innallāha `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: O mankind! Worship your Lord, who created you and those who were before you, so that you may be Godwary
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhan nāsu'-budū rabbakumul ladhī khalaqakum wal ladhīna min qablikum la`allakum tattaqūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فِرَٰشًا وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بِنَآءً وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَخْرَجَ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ رِزْقًا لَّكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تَجْعَلُوا۟ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: —He who made the earth a place of repose for you, and the sky a canopy, and He sends down water from the sky and with it brings forth crops for your sustenance. So do not set up equals to Allah, while you know.
rows.transliteration: alladhī ja`ala lakumul-arḍa firāshan was samā-a binā-an wa-anzala minas samā-i mā-an fa-akhraja bihi minath thamarāti rizqal lakum ۖ falā taj`alū lillāhi andādan wa-antum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَإِن كُنتُمْ فِى رَيْبٍ مِّمَّا نَزَّلْنَا عَلَىٰ عَبْدِنَا فَأْتُوا۟ بِسُورَةٍ مِّن مِّثْلِهِۦ وَٱدْعُوا۟ شُهَدَآءَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: And if you are in doubt concerning what We have sent down to Our servant, then bring a surah like it, and invoke your helpers besides Allah, if you are truthful.
rows.transliteration: wa in kuntum fī raybin mimmā nazzalnā `alā `abdinā fa-tū bisūratim min mithlihi wad`ū shuhadā-akum min dūnillāhi in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ تَفْعَلُوا۟ وَلَن تَفْعَلُوا۟ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِى وَقُودُهَا ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلْحِجَارَةُ ۖ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: But if you do not—and you will not—then beware the Fire whose fuel will be humans and stones, prepared for the faithless.
rows.transliteration: fa-in lam taf`alū walan taf`alū fattaqun nāral latī waqūduhan nāsu wal ḥijārah ۖ u`iddat lilkāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَبَشِّرِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ كُلَّمَا رُزِقُوا۟ مِنْهَا مِن ثَمَرَةٍ رِّزْقًا ۙ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى رُزِقْنَا مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَأُتُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُتَشَـٰبِهًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِيهَآ أَزْوَٰجٌ مُّطَهَّرَةٌ ۖ وَهُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: And give good news to those who have faith and do righteous deeds, that for them shall be gardens with streams running in them: whenever they are provided with their fruit for nourishment, they will say, ‘This is what we were provided before,’ and they were given something resembling it. There will be chaste mates for them, and they will remain therein [forever].
rows.transliteration: wabashhiril ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti anna lahum jannātin tajrī min taḥtihal-anhār ۖ kullamā ruziqū minhā min thamaratin rizqan qālū hādhal ladhī ruziqnā min qabl ۖ wa-utū bihi mutashābihā ۖ walahum fīhā azwājun muṭahharah ۖ wahum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَسْتَحْىِۦٓ أَن يَضْرِبَ مَثَلًا مَّا بَعُوضَةً فَمَا فَوْقَهَا ۚ فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ فَيَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّهُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَيَقُولُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَـٰذَا مَثَلًا ۘ يُضِلُّ بِهِۦ كَثِيرًا وَيَهْدِى بِهِۦ كَثِيرًا ۚ وَمَا يُضِلُّ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
rows.translation: Indeed Allah is not ashamed to draw a parable whether it is that of a gnat or something above it. As for those who have faith, they know it is the truth from their Lord; and as for the faithless, they say, ‘What did Allah mean by this parable?’ Thereby He leads many astray, and thereby He guides many; and He leads no one astray thereby except the transgressors
rows.transliteration: innallāha lā yastaḥyī an yaḍriba mathalan mā ba`ūḍatan famā fawqahā ۚ fa-ammal ladhīna āmanū faya`lamūna annahul ḥaqqu min rabbihim ۖ wa-ammal ladhīna kafarū fayaqūlūna mādhā arādallāhu bihādhā mathalā ۘ yuḍillu bihi kathīran wayahdī bihi kathīrā ۚ wa mā yuḍillu bihi illal-fāsiqīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مِيثَـٰقِهِۦ وَيَقْطَعُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: —those who break the covenant made with Allah after having pledged it solemnly, and sever what Allah has commanded to be joined, and cause corruption on the earth—it is they who are the losers.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yanquḍūna `ahdallāhi min ba`di mīthāqihi wayaqṭa`ūna mā amarallāhu bihi an yūṣala wayufsidūna fil-arḍ ۚ ulā-ika humul khāsirūn

rows.arabic: كَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَكُنتُمْ أَمْوَٰتًا فَأَحْيَـٰكُمْ ۖ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: How can you be unfaithful to Allah, [seeing that] you were lifeless and He gave you life, then He will make you die and then bring you to life, and then you will be brought back to Him?
rows.transliteration: kayfa takfurūna billāhi wakuntum amwātan fa-aḥyākum ۖ thumma yumītukum thumma yuḥyīkum thumma ilayhi turja`ūn

rows.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَسَوَّىٰهُنَّ سَبْعَ سَمَـٰوَٰتٍ ۚ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: It is He who created for you all that is in the earth, then He turned to the heaven and fashioned it into seven heavens, and He has knowledge of all things.
rows.transliteration: huwal ladhī khalaqa lakum mā fil-arḍi jamī`an thummas-tawā ilas samā-i fasawwāhunna sab`a samāwāt ۚ wahuwa bikulli shay-in `alīm

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّى جَاعِلٌ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ خَلِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ أَتَجْعَلُ فِيهَا مَن يُفْسِدُ فِيهَا وَيَسْفِكُ ٱلدِّمَآءَ وَنَحْنُ نُسَبِّحُ بِحَمْدِكَ وَنُقَدِّسُ لَكَ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am going to set a viceroy on the earth,’ they said, ‘Will You set in it someone who will cause corruption in it and shed blood, while we celebrate Your praise and proclaim Your sanctity?’ He said, ‘Indeed I know what you do not know.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla rabbuka lil-malā-ikati innī jā`ilun fil-arḍi khalīfah ۖ qālū ataj`alu fīhā man yufsidu fīhā wayasfikud dimā-a wanaḥnu nusabbiḥu biḥamdika wanuqaddisu lak ۖ qāla innī a`lamu mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَعَلَّمَ ءَادَمَ ٱلْأَسْمَآءَ كُلَّهَا ثُمَّ عَرَضَهُمْ عَلَى ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ فَقَالَ أَنۢبِـُٔونِى بِأَسْمَآءِ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: And He taught Adam the Names, all of them; then presented them to the angels and said, ‘Tell me the names of these, if you are truthful.’
rows.transliteration: wa`allama ādamal-asmā-a kullahā thumma `araḍahum `alal-malā-ikati faqāla anbi-ūnī bi-asmā-i hā-ulā-i in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ لَا عِلْمَ لَنَآ إِلَّا مَا عَلَّمْتَنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Immaculate are You! We have no knowledge except what You have taught us. Indeed You are the All-knowing, the All-wise.’
rows.transliteration: qālū subḥānaka lā `il-ma lanā illā mā `allamtanā ۖ innaka antal `alīmul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ أَنۢبِئْهُم بِأَسْمَآئِهِمْ ۖ فَلَمَّآ أَنۢبَأَهُم بِأَسْمَآئِهِمْ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَأَعْلَمُ مَا تُبْدُونَ وَمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْتُمُونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘O Adam, inform them of their names,’ and when he had informed them of their names, He said, ‘Did I not tell you that I know the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and that I know whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal?’
rows.transliteration: qāla yā-ādamu anbi-hum bi-asmā-ihim ۖ falammā anba-ahum bi-asmā-ihim qāla alam aqul lakum innī a`lamu ghaybas samāwāti wal-arḍi wa-a`lamu mā tubdūna wa mā kuntum taktumūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ وَٱسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And when We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis: he refused and acted arrogantly, and he was one of the faithless.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qulnā lil-malā-ikatis-judū li-ādama fasajadū illā iblīsa abā wastakbara wakāna minal kāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَقُلْنَا يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ ٱسْكُنْ أَنتَ وَزَوْجُكَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَكُلَا مِنْهَا رَغَدًا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمَا وَلَا تَقْرَبَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: We said, ‘O Adam, dwell with your mate in paradise and eat thereof freely whencesoever you wish, but do not approach this tree, lest you should be among the wrongdoers.’
rows.transliteration: waqulnā yā-ādamus skun anta wazawjukal jannata wakulā minhā raghadan ḥaythu shi-tumā walā taqrabā hādhihish shajarata fatakūnā minaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: فَأَزَلَّهُمَا ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ عَنْهَا فَأَخْرَجَهُمَا مِمَّا كَانَا فِيهِ ۖ وَقُلْنَا ٱهْبِطُوا۟ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُسْتَقَرٌّ وَمَتَـٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: Then Satan caused them to stumble from it, and he dislodged them from what [state] they were in; and We said, ‘Get down, being enemies of one another! On the earth shall be your abode and sustenance for a time.’
rows.transliteration: fa-azallahumash shayṭānu `anhā fa-akhrajahumā mimmā kānā fīh ۖ waqulnah-biṭū ba`ḍukum liba`ḍin `aduww ۖ walakum fil-arḍi mustaqarrun wa matā`un ilā ḥīn

rows.arabic: فَتَلَقَّىٰٓ ءَادَمُ مِن رَّبِّهِۦ كَلِمَـٰتٍ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
rows.translation: Then Adam received certain words from his Lord, and He turned to him clemently. Indeed He is the All-clement, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: fatalaqqā ādamu min rabbihi kalimātin fatāba `alayh ۚ innahu huwat tawwābur raḥīm

rows.arabic: قُلْنَا ٱهْبِطُوا۟ مِنْهَا جَمِيعًا ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُم مِّنِّى هُدًى فَمَن تَبِعَ هُدَاىَ فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
rows.translation: We said, ‘Get down from it, all together! Yet, should any guidance come to you from Me, those who follow My guidance shall have no fear, nor shall they grieve.
rows.transliteration: qulnah-biṭū minhā jamī`ā ۖ fa-immā ya-tiyannakum minnī hudan faman tabi`a hudāya falā khawfun `alayhim walā hum yaḥzanūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: But those who are faithless and deny Our signs, they shall be the inmates of the Fire and they shall remain in it [forever].
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna kafarū wakadhhabū bi-āyātinā ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتِىَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَأَوْفُوا۟ بِعَهْدِىٓ أُوفِ بِعَهْدِكُمْ وَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱرْهَبُونِ
rows.translation: O Children of Israel, remember My blessing which I bestowed upon you, and fulfill My covenant that I may fulfill your covenant, and be in awe of Me [alone].
rows.transliteration: yābanī isrā-iyladh-kurū ni`matiyal latī an`amtu `alaykum wa-awfū bi`ahdī ūfi bi`ahdikum wa iyyāya farhabūn

rows.arabic: وَءَامِنُوا۟ بِمَآ أَنزَلْتُ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا مَعَكُمْ وَلَا تَكُونُوٓا۟ أَوَّلَ كَافِرٍۭ بِهِۦ ۖ وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِى ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا وَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱتَّقُونِ
rows.translation: And believe in that which I have sent down confirming that which is with you, and do not be the first ones to deny it, and do not sell My signs for a paltry gain, and be wary of Me [alone].
rows.transliteration: wa-āminū bimā anzaltu muṣaddiqal limā ma`akum walā takūnū awwala kāfirin bih ۖ walā tashtarū bi-āyātī thamanan qalīlan wa iyyāya fattaqūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَلْبِسُوا۟ ٱلْحَقَّ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَتَكْتُمُوا۟ ٱلْحَقَّ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Do not mix the truth with falsehood, nor conceal the truth while you know.
rows.transliteration: walā talbisul ḥaqqa bil bāṭili wataktumul ḥaqqa wa-antum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَٱرْكَعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱلرَّٰكِعِينَ
rows.translation: And maintain the prayer, and give the zakat, and bow along with those who bow [in prayer].
rows.transliteration: wa-aqīmuṣ ṣalāta wa-ātuz zakāta warka`ū ma`ar rāki`īn

rows.arabic: أَتَأْمُرُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ بِٱلْبِرِّ وَتَنسَوْنَ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ تَتْلُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: Will you bid others to piety and forget yourselves, while you recite the Book? Do you not exercise your reason?
rows.transliteration: ata-murūnan nāsa bil birri watansawna anfusakum wa-antum tatlūnal kitāb ۚ afalā ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ وَإِنَّهَا لَكَبِيرَةٌ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلْخَـٰشِعِينَ
rows.translation: And take recourse in patience and prayer, and it is indeed hard except for the humble
rows.transliteration: wasta`īnū biṣ ṣabri waṣ ṣalāh ۚ wa innahā lakabīratun illā `alal-khāshi`īn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَظُنُّونَ أَنَّهُم مُّلَـٰقُوا۟ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ رَٰجِعُونَ
rows.translation: —those who are certain that they will encounter their Lord and that they will return to Him.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yaẓunnūna annahum mulāqū rabbihim wa-annahum ilayhi rāji`ūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتِىَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَأَنِّى فَضَّلْتُكُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: O Children of Israel, remember My blessing which I bestowed upon you, and that I gave you an advantage over all the nations.
rows.transliteration: yābanī isrā-iyladh-kurū ni`matiyal latī an`amtu `alaykum wa-annī faḍḍaltukum `alal-`ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ يَوْمًا لَّا تَجْزِى نَفْسٌ عَن نَّفْسٍ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا يُقْبَلُ مِنْهَا شَفَـٰعَةٌ وَلَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنْهَا عَدْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
rows.translation: Beware of the day when no soul will compensate for another, neither any intercession shall be accepted from it, nor any ransom shall be received from it, nor will they be helped.
rows.transliteration: wattaqū yawmal lā tajzī nafsun `an nafsin shay-an walā yuqbalu minhā shafā`atun walā yu-khadhu minhā `adlun walā hum yunṣarūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ نَجَّيْنَـٰكُم مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ يُذَبِّحُونَ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: [Remember] when We delivered you from Pharaoh’s clan who inflicted a terrible torment on you, and slaughtered your sons and spared your women, and in that there was a great test from your Lord.
rows.transliteration: wa idh najjaynākum min āli fir`awna yasūmūnakum sū al `adhābi yudhabbiḥūna abnā-akum wayastaḥyūna nisā-akum ۚ wafī dhālikum balā-un min rabbikum `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ فَرَقْنَا بِكُمُ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَأَنجَيْنَـٰكُمْ وَأَغْرَقْنَآ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: And when We parted the sea with you, and We delivered you and drowned Pharaoh’s clan as you looked on.
rows.transliteration: wa idh faraqnā bikumul baḥra fa-anjaynākum wa-aghraqnā āla fir`awna wa-antum tanẓurūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ وَٰعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰٓ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةً ثُمَّ ٱتَّخَذْتُمُ ٱلْعِجْلَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ وَأَنتُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: And when We made an appointment with Moses for forty nights, you took up the Calf [for worship] in his absence, and you were wrongdoers.
rows.transliteration: wa idh wā`adnā mūsā arba`īna laylatan thummat-takhadhtumul `ijla min ba`dihi wa-antum ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ عَفَوْنَا عَنكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: Then We excused you after that so that you might give thanks.
rows.transliteration: thumma `afawnā `ankum min ba`di dhālika la`allakum tashkurūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْفُرْقَانَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And when We gave Moses the Book and the Criterion so that you might be guided.
rows.transliteration: wa idh ātaynā mūsal kitāba wal furqāna la`allakum tahtadūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنَّكُمْ ظَلَمْتُمْ أَنفُسَكُم بِٱتِّخَاذِكُمُ ٱلْعِجْلَ فَتُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ بَارِئِكُمْ فَٱقْتُلُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ عِندَ بَارِئِكُمْ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
rows.translation: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, ‘O my people! You have indeed wronged yourselves by taking up the Calf [for worship]. Now turn penitently to your Maker, and slay [the guilty among] your folks. That will be better for you with your Maker.’ Then He turned to you clemently. Indeed, He is the All-clement, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla mūsā liqawmihi yāqawmi innakum ẓalamtum anfusakum bīttikhādhikumul `ijla fatūbū ilā bāri-ikum faqtulū anfusakum dhālikum khayrul lakum `inda bāri-ikum fatāba `alaykum ۚ innahu huwat tawwābur raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْتُمْ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَن نُّؤْمِنَ لَكَ حَتَّىٰ نَرَى ٱللَّهَ جَهْرَةً فَأَخَذَتْكُمُ ٱلصَّـٰعِقَةُ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: And when you said, ‘O Moses, we will not believe you until we see Allah visibly.’ Thereupon a thunderbolt seized you as you looked on.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qultum yāmūsā lan nu-mina laka ḥattā narallāha jahratan fa-akhadhatkumuṣ ṣā`iqatu wa-antum tanẓurūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَـٰكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَوْتِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: Then We raised you up after your death so that you might give thanks.
rows.transliteration: thumma ba`athnākum min ba`di mawtikum la`allakum tashkurūn

rows.arabic: وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْغَمَامَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَنَّ وَٱلسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ ۖ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: We shaded you with clouds, and sent down to you manna and quails [saying]: ‘Eat of the good things We have provided for you.’ And they did not wrong Us, but they used to wrong [only] themselves.
rows.transliteration: waẓallalnā `alaykumul ghamāma wa-anzalnā `alaykumul manna was salwā ۖ kulū min ṭayyibāti mā razaqnākum ۖ wa mā ẓalamūnā walākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا ٱدْخُلُوا۟ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةَ فَكُلُوا۟ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ رَغَدًا وَٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْبَابَ سُجَّدًا وَقُولُوا۟ حِطَّةٌ نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطَـٰيَـٰكُمْ ۚ وَسَنَزِيدُ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: And when We said, ‘Enter this town, and eat thereof freely whencesoever you wish, and enter while prostrating at the gate, and say, ‘‘Relieve [us of the burden of our sins],’’ so that We may forgive your iniquities and We will soon enhance the virtuous.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh qulnad-khulū hādhihil qaryata fakulū minhā ḥaythu shi-tum raghadan wadkhulul bāba sujjadan waqūlū ḥiṭṭatun naghfir lakum khaṭāyākum ۚ wasanazīdul muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: فَبَدَّلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ قَوْلًا غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى قِيلَ لَهُمْ فَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ رِجْزًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْسُقُونَ
rows.translation: But the wrongdoers changed the saying with other than what they were told. So We sent down on those who were wrongdoers a plague from the sky because of the transgressions they used to commit.
rows.transliteration: fabaddalal ladhīna ẓalamū qawlan ghayral ladhī qīla lahum fa-anzalnā `alal ladhīna ẓalamū rijzan minas samā-i bimā kānū yafsuqūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذِ ٱسْتَسْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ فَقُلْنَا ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْحَجَرَ ۖ فَٱنفَجَرَتْ مِنْهُ ٱثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنَاسٍ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۖ كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: And when Moses prayed for water for his people, We said, ‘Strike the rock with your staff.’ Thereat twelve fountains gushed forth from it; every tribe came to know its drinking-place. ‘Eat and drink of Allah’s provision, and do not act wickedly on the earth, causing corruption.’
rows.transliteration: wa idhis-tasqā mūsā liqawmihi faqulnaḍ-rib bi`aṣākal ḥajar ۖ fanfajarat minhuth-natā `ashrata `aynā ۖ qad `alima kullu unāsin mashrabahum ۖ kulū washrabū min rizqillāhi walā ta`thaw fil-arḍi mufsidīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْتُمْ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَن نَّصْبِرَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامٍ وَٰحِدٍ فَٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُخْرِجْ لَنَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلْأَرْضُ مِنۢ بَقْلِهَا وَقِثَّآئِهَا وَفُومِهَا وَعَدَسِهَا وَبَصَلِهَا ۖ قَالَ أَتَسْتَبْدِلُونَ ٱلَّذِى هُوَ أَدْنَىٰ بِٱلَّذِى هُوَ خَيْرٌ ۚ ٱهْبِطُوا۟ مِصْرًا فَإِنَّ لَكُم مَّا سَأَلْتُمْ ۗ وَضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلذِّلَّةُ وَٱلْمَسْكَنَةُ وَبَآءُو بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوا۟ وَّكَانُوا۟ يَعْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And when you said, ‘O Moses, ‘We will not put up with one kind of food. So invoke your Lord for us, so that He may bring forth for us of that which the earth grows—its greens and cucumbers, its garlic, lentils, and onions.’ He said, ‘Do you seek to replace what is superior with that which is inferior? Go down to any town and you will indeed get what you ask for!’ So they were struck with abasement and poverty, and they earned Allah’s wrath. That, because they would deny the signs of Allah and kill the prophets unjustly. That, because they would disobey and commit transgressions.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qultum yāmūsā lan naṣbira `alā ṭa`āmin wāḥidin fad`u lanā rabbaka yukhrij lanā mimmā tunbitul-arḍu min baqlihā waqithhā-ihā wafūmihā wa`adasihā wabaṣalihā ۖ qāla atastabdilūnal ladhī huwa adnā bil ladhī huwa khayr ۚ ihbiṭū miṣran fa-inna lakum mā sa-altum ۗ waḍuribat `alayhimudh dhillatu wal maskanatu wabā-ū bighaḍabin minallāh ۗ dhālika bi-annahum kānū yakfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wayaqtulūnan nabiyyīna bighayril ḥaqq ۗ dhālika bimā `aṣaw wakānū ya`tadūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوا۟ وَٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ وَٱلصَّـٰبِـِٔينَ مَنْ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا فَلَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed the faithful, the Jews, the Christians and the Sabaeans—those of them who have faith in Allah and the Last Day and act righteously—they shall have their reward from their Lord, and they will have no fear, nor will they grieve.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna āmanū wal ladhīna hādū wan naṣārā waṣ ṣābi-īna man āmana billāhi wal yawmil-ākhiri wa`amila ṣāliḥan falahum ajruhum `inda rabbihim walā khawfun `alayhim walā hum yaḥzanūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَـٰقَكُمْ وَرَفَعْنَا فَوْقَكُمُ ٱلطُّورَ خُذُوا۟ مَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ مَا فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: And when We took a pledge from you, and raised the Mount above you, [declaring], ‘Hold on with power to what We have given you and remember that which is in it so that you may be Godwary.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh akhadhnā mīthāqakum warafa`nā fawqakumuṭ ṭūra khudhū mā ātaynākum biquwwatin wadhkurū mā fīhi la`allakum tattaqūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّيْتُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ فَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُۥ لَكُنتُم مِّنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
rows.translation: Again you turned away after that; and were it not for Allah’s grace on you and His mercy, you would have surely been among the losers.
rows.transliteration: thumma tawallaytum min ba`di dhālik ۖ falawlā faḍlullāhi `alaykum waraḥmatuhu lakuntum minal khāsirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱعْتَدَوْا۟ مِنكُمْ فِى ٱلسَّبْتِ فَقُلْنَا لَهُمْ كُونُوا۟ قِرَدَةً خَـٰسِـِٔينَ
rows.translation: And certainly you know those of you who violated the Sabbath, whereupon We said to them, ‘Be you spurned apes.’
rows.transliteration: walaqad `alimtumul ladhīna'-tadaw minkum fis sabti faqulnā lahum kūnū qiradatan khāsi-īn

rows.arabic: فَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا نَكَـٰلًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهَا وَمَا خَلْفَهَا وَمَوْعِظَةً لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: So We made it an exemplary punishment for the present and the succeeding [generations], and an advice to the Godwary.
rows.transliteration: faja`alnāhā nakālal limā bayna yadayhā wa mā khalfahā wa maw`iẓatan lil-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأْمُرُكُمْ أَن تَذْبَحُوا۟ بَقَرَةً ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ أَتَتَّخِذُنَا هُزُوًا ۖ قَالَ أَعُوذُ بِٱللَّهِ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِينَ
rows.translation: And when Moses said to his people, ‘Allah commands you to slaughter a cow,’ they said, ‘Are you mocking us?’ He said, ‘I seek Allah’s protection lest I should be one of the ignorant!’
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla mūsā liqawmihi innallāha ya-murukum an tadhbaḥū baqarah ۖ qālū atattakhidhunā huzuwā ۖ qāla a`ūdhu billāhi an akūna minal jāhilīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِىَ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ لَّا فَارِضٌ وَلَا بِكْرٌ عَوَانٌۢ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ فَٱفْعَلُوا۟ مَا تُؤْمَرُونَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Invoke your Lord for us that He may clarify for us what she may be.’ He said, ‘He says, she is a cow, neither old nor young, of a middle age. Now do what you are commanded.’
rows.transliteration: qālud-`u lanā rabbaka yubayyin lanā mā hiy ۚ qāla innahu yaqūlu innahā baqaratun lā fāriḍun walā bikrun `awānun bayna dhālik ۖ faf`alū mā tu-marūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا لَوْنُهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ صَفْرَآءُ فَاقِعٌ لَّوْنُهَا تَسُرُّ ٱلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Invoke your Lord for us that He may clarify for us what her colour may be.’ He said, ‘He says, she is a cow that is yellow, of a bright hue, pleasing to the onlookers.’
rows.transliteration: qālud-`u lanā rabbaka yubayyin lanā mā lawnuhā ۚ qāla innahu yaqūlu innahā baqaratun ṣafrā-u fāqi`ul lawnuhā tasurrun nāẓirīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِىَ إِنَّ ٱلْبَقَرَ تَشَـٰبَهَ عَلَيْنَا وَإِنَّآ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَمُهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Invoke your Lord for us that He may clarify for us what she may be. Indeed all cows are much alike to us, and if Allah wishes we will surely be guided.’
rows.transliteration: qālud-`u lanā rabbaka yubayyin lanā mā hiya innal baqara tashābaha `alaynā wa innā in shā-allāhu lamuhtadūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ لَّا ذَلُولٌ تُثِيرُ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَلَا تَسْقِى ٱلْحَرْثَ مُسَلَّمَةٌ لَّا شِيَةَ فِيهَا ۚ قَالُوا۟ ٱلْـَٔـٰنَ جِئْتَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ فَذَبَحُوهَا وَمَا كَادُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘He says, She is a cow not broken to till the earth or water the tillage, sound and without blemish.’ They said, ‘Now have you come up with the truth!’ And they slaughtered it, though they were about not to do it.
rows.transliteration: qāla innahu yaqūlu innahā baqaratun lā dhalūlun tuthīrul-arḍa walā tasqil ḥartha musallamatun lā shiyata fīhā ۚ qālul-āna ji-ta bil ḥaqq ۚ fadhabaḥūhā wa mā kādū yaf`alūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَتَلْتُمْ نَفْسًا فَٱدَّٰرَْٰٔتُمْ فِيهَا ۖ وَٱللَّهُ مُخْرِجٌ مَّا كُنتُمْ تَكْتُمُونَ
rows.translation: And when you killed a soul, and accused one another about it—and Allah was to expose what you were concealing—
rows.transliteration: wa idh qataltum nafsan faddāra-tum fīhā ۖ wallāhu mukhrijun mā kuntum taktumūn

rows.arabic: فَقُلْنَا ٱضْرِبُوهُ بِبَعْضِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُحْىِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: We said, ‘Strike him with a piece of it:’ thus does Allah revive the dead, and He shows you His signs so that you may exercise your reason.
rows.transliteration: faqulnaḍ-ribūhu biba`ḍihā ۚ kadhālika yuḥyillāhul mawtā wayurīkum āyātihi la`allakum ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ قَسَتْ قُلُوبُكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ فَهِىَ كَٱلْحِجَارَةِ أَوْ أَشَدُّ قَسْوَةً ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنَ ٱلْحِجَارَةِ لَمَا يَتَفَجَّرُ مِنْهُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنْهَا لَمَا يَشَّقَّقُ فَيَخْرُجُ مِنْهُ ٱلْمَآءُ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنْهَا لَمَا يَهْبِطُ مِنْ خَشْيَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Then your hearts hardened after that; so they are like stones, or even harder. For there are some stones from which streams gush forth, and there are some of them that split, and water issues from them, and there are some that fall for the fear of Allah. And Allah is not oblivious of what you do.
rows.transliteration: thumma qasat qulūbukum min ba`di dhālika fahiya kal ḥijārati aw ashaddu qaswah ۚ wa inna minal ḥijārati lamā yatafajjaru minhul-anhār ۚ wa inna minhā lamā yashhaqqaqu fayakhruju minhul mā-u ۚ wa inna minhā lamā yahbiṭu min khashyatil lāh ۗ wa mallāhu bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn

rows.arabic: أَفَتَطْمَعُونَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ لَكُمْ وَقَدْ كَانَ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ كَلَـٰمَ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُحَرِّفُونَهُۥ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا عَقَلُوهُ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Are you then eager that they should believe you, though a part of them would hear the word of Allah and then they would distort it after they had understood it, and they knew [what they were doing]?
rows.transliteration: afataṭma`ūna an yu-minū lakum waqad kāna farīqun minhum yasma`ūna kalāmallāhi thumma yuḥarrifūnahu min ba`di mā `aqalūhu wahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا لَقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ قَالُوٓا۟ أَتُحَدِّثُونَهُم بِمَا فَتَحَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمْ لِيُحَآجُّوكُم بِهِۦ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: When they meet the faithful, they say, ‘We believe,’ and when they are alone with one another, they say, ‘Do you recount to them what Allah has revealed to you, so that they may argue with you therewith before your Lord? Do you not exercise your reason?’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā laqul ladhīna āmanū qālū āmannā wa idhā khalā ba`ḍuhum ilā ba`ḍin qālū atuḥaddithūnahum bimā fataḥallāhu `alaykum liyuḥājjūkum bihi `inda rabbikum ۚ afalā ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَا يَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
rows.translation: Do they not know that Allah knows whatever they hide and whatever they disclose?
rows.transliteration: awalā ya`lamūna annallāha ya`lamu mā yusirrūna wa mā yu`linūn

rows.arabic: وَمِنْهُمْ أُمِّيُّونَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّآ أَمَانِىَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ
rows.translation: And among them are the illiterate who know nothing of the Book except hearsay, and they only make conjectures.
rows.transliteration: wa minhum ummiyyūna lā ya`lamūnal kitāba illā amāniyya wa in hum illā yaẓunnūn

rows.arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَكْتُبُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ ثُمَّ يَقُولُونَ هَـٰذَا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ لِيَشْتَرُوا۟ بِهِۦ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لَّهُم مِّمَّا كَتَبَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَوَيْلٌ لَّهُم مِّمَّا يَكْسِبُونَ
rows.translation: So woe to them who write the Book with their hands and then say, ‘This is from Allah,’ that they may sell it for a paltry gain. So woe to them for what their hands have written, and woe to them for what they earn!
rows.transliteration: fawaylul lilladhīna yaktubūnal kitāba bi-aydīhim thumma yaqūlūna hādhā min `indillāhi liyashtarū bihi thamanan qalīlā ۖ fawaylul lahum mimmā katabat aydīhim wawaylul lahum mimmā yaksibūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَن تَمَسَّنَا ٱلنَّارُ إِلَّآ أَيَّامًا مَّعْدُودَةً ۚ قُلْ أَتَّخَذْتُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ عَهْدًا فَلَن يُخْلِفَ ٱللَّهُ عَهْدَهُۥٓ ۖ أَمْ تَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And they say, ‘The Fire shall not touch us except for a number of days.’ Say, ‘Have you taken a promise from Allah? If so, Allah will never break His promise. Do you ascribe to Allah what you do not know?’
rows.transliteration: waqālū lan tamassanan nāru illā ayyāman ma`dūdah ۚ qul attakhadhtum `indallāhi `ahdan falan yukhlifallāhu `ahdah ۖ am taqūlūna `alallāhi mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: بَلَىٰ مَن كَسَبَ سَيِّئَةً وَأَحَـٰطَتْ بِهِۦ خَطِيٓـَٔتُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly whoever commits misdeeds and is besieged by his iniquity—such shall be the inmates of the Fire, and they will remain in it [forever].
rows.transliteration: balā man kasaba sayyi-atan wa-aḥāṭat bihi khaṭī-atuhu fa-ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: And those who have faith and do righteous deeds—they shall be the inhabitants of paradise; they will remain in it [forever].
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābul jannah ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَـٰقَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ لَا تَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ وَبِٱلْوَٰلِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا وَذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَـٰكِينِ وَقُولُوا۟ لِلنَّاسِ حُسْنًا وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّيْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّنكُمْ وَأَنتُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
rows.translation: When We took a pledge from the Children of Israel, [saying]: ‘Worship no one but Allah, do good to your parents, relatives, orphans, and the needy, speak kindly to people, maintain the prayer, and give the zakat,’ you turned away, except a few of you, and you were disregardful.
rows.transliteration: wa idh akhadhnā mīthāqa banī isrā-iyla lā ta`budūna illallāha wabil wālidayni iḥsānan wadhil qurbā wal yatāmā wal masākīni waqūlū linnāsi ḥusnan wa-aqīmuṣ ṣalāta wa-ātuz zakāta thumma tawallaytum illā qalīlan minkum wa-antum mu`riḍūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَـٰقَكُمْ لَا تَسْفِكُونَ دِمَآءَكُمْ وَلَا تُخْرِجُونَ أَنفُسَكُم مِّن دِيَـٰرِكُمْ ثُمَّ أَقْرَرْتُمْ وَأَنتُمْ تَشْهَدُونَ
rows.translation: And when We took a pledge from you, [saying]: ‘You shall not shed your [own people’s] blood, and you shall not expel your folks from your homes,’ you pledged, and you testify [to this pledge of your ancestors].
rows.transliteration: wa idh akhadhnā mīthāqakum lā tasfikūna dimā-akum walā tukhrijūna anfusakum min diyārikum thumma aqrartum wa-antum tash-hadūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنتُمْ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ تَقْتُلُونَ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَتُخْرِجُونَ فَرِيقًا مِّنكُم مِّن دِيَـٰرِهِمْ تَظَـٰهَرُونَ عَلَيْهِم بِٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْعُدْوَٰنِ وَإِن يَأْتُوكُمْ أُسَـٰرَىٰ تُفَـٰدُوهُمْ وَهُوَ مُحَرَّمٌ عَلَيْكُمْ إِخْرَاجُهُمْ ۚ أَفَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِبَعْضِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَتَكْفُرُونَ بِبَعْضٍ ۚ فَمَا جَزَآءُ مَن يَفْعَلُ ذَٰلِكَ مِنكُمْ إِلَّا خِزْىٌ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَيَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰٓ أَشَدِّ ٱلْعَذَابِ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Then there you were, killing your folks and expelling a part of your folks from their homes, backing one another against them in sin and aggression! And if they came to you as captives, you would ransom them, though their expulsion itself was forbidden you. What! Do you believe in part of the Book and deny another part? So what is the requital of those of you who do that except disgrace in the life of this world? And on the Day of Resurrection, they shall be consigned to the severest punishment. And Allah is not oblivious of what you do.
rows.transliteration: thumma antum hā-ulā-i taqtulūna anfusakum watukhrijūna farīqan minkum min diyārihim taẓāharūna `alayhim bil-ithmi wal `udwāni wa in ya-tūkum usārā tufādūhum wahuwa muḥarramun `alaykum ikhrājuhum ۚ afatu-minūna biba`ḍil kitābi watakfurūna biba`ḍ ۚ famā jazā-u man yaf`alu dhālika minkum illā khizyun fil ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wayawmal qiyāmati yuraddūna ilā ashaddil `adhāb ۗ wa mallāhu bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱشْتَرَوُا۟ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ فَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
rows.translation: They are the ones who bought the life of this world for the Hereafter; so their punishment shall not be lightened, nor will they be helped.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīnash-tarawul ḥayātad dunyā bil-ākhirah ۖ falā yukhaffafu `anhumul `adhābu walā hum yunṣarūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَقَفَّيْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ بِٱلرُّسُلِ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَا عِيسَى ٱبْنَ مَرْيَمَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَأَيَّدْنَـٰهُ بِرُوحِ ٱلْقُدُسِ ۗ أَفَكُلَّمَا جَآءَكُمْ رَسُولٌۢ بِمَا لَا تَهْوَىٰٓ أَنفُسُكُمُ ٱسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ فَفَرِيقًا كَذَّبْتُمْ وَفَرِيقًا تَقْتُلُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly, We gave Moses the Book and followed him with the apostles, and We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, manifest proofs and confirmed him with the Holy Spirit. Is it not that whenever an apostle brought you that which was not to your liking, you would act arrogantly; so you would impugn a group [of them], and slay a[nother] group?
rows.transliteration: walaqad ātaynā mūsal kitāba waqaffaynā min ba`dihi bir rusul ۖ wa-ātaynā `īsab-na maryamal bayyināti wa-ayyadnāhu birūḥil qudus ۗ afakullamā jā-akum rasūlun bimā lā tahwā anfusukumus takbartum fafarīqan kadhhabtum wafarīqan taqtulūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ قُلُوبُنَا غُلْفٌۢ ۚ بَل لَّعَنَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِكُفْرِهِمْ فَقَلِيلًا مَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: And they say, ‘Our hearts are uncircumcised.’ Rather, Allah has cursed them for their unfaith, so few of them have faith.
rows.transliteration: waqālū qulūbunā ghulf ۚ bal la`anahumullāhu bikufrihim faqalīlan mā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ كِتَـٰبٌ مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ مُصَدِّقٌ لِّمَا مَعَهُمْ وَكَانُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ يَسْتَفْتِحُونَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم مَّا عَرَفُوا۟ كَفَرُوا۟ بِهِۦ ۚ فَلَعْنَةُ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And when there came to them a Book from Allah, confirming that which is with them—and earlier they would pray for victory over the pagans—so when there came to them what they recognized, they denied it. So may the curse of Allah be on the faithless!
rows.transliteration: walammā jā-ahum kitābun min `indillāhi muṣaddiqul limā ma`ahum wakānū min qablu yastaftiḥūna `alal ladhīna kafarū falammā jā-ahum mā `arafū kafarū bih ۚ fala`natullāhi `alal-kāfirīn

rows.arabic: بِئْسَمَا ٱشْتَرَوْا۟ بِهِۦٓ أَنفُسَهُمْ أَن يَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بَغْيًا أَن يُنَزِّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ ۖ فَبَآءُو بِغَضَبٍ عَلَىٰ غَضَبٍ ۚ وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ مُّهِينٌ
rows.translation: Evil is that for which they have sold their souls, by defying what Allah has sent down, out of envy that Allah should bestow His grace on any of His servants that He wishes. Thus, they earned wrath upon wrath, and there is a humiliating punishment for the faithless.
rows.transliteration: bi-samash-taraw bihi anfusahum an yakfurū bimā anzalallāhu baghyan an yunazzilallāhu min faḍlihi `alā man yashā-u min `ibādih ۖ fabā-ū bighaḍabin `alā ghaḍab ۚ walilkāfirīna `adhābun muhīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ ءَامِنُوا۟ بِمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ قَالُوا۟ نُؤْمِنُ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا وَيَكْفُرُونَ بِمَا وَرَآءَهُۥ وَهُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا مَعَهُمْ ۗ قُلْ فَلِمَ تَقْتُلُونَ أَنۢبِيَآءَ ٱللَّهِ مِن قَبْلُ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And when they are told, ‘Believe in what Allah has sent down,’ they say, ‘We believe in what was sent down to us,’ and they disbelieve what is besides it, though it is the truth confirming what is with them. Say, ‘Then why would you kill the prophets of Allah formerly, should you be faithful?’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā qīla lahum āminū bimā anzalallāhu qālū nu-minu bimā unzila `alaynā wayakfurūna bimā warā-ahu wahuwal ḥaqqu muṣaddiqal limā ma`ahum ۗ qul falima taqtulūna anbiyā-allāhi min qablu in kuntum mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَكُم مُّوسَىٰ بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ ثُمَّ ٱتَّخَذْتُمُ ٱلْعِجْلَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ وَأَنتُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly Moses brought you manifest proofs, but then you took up the Calf in his absence and you were wrongdoers.
rows.transliteration: walaqad jā-akum mūsā bil bayyināti thummat-takhadhtumul `ijla min ba`dihi wa-antum ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَـٰقَكُمْ وَرَفَعْنَا فَوْقَكُمُ ٱلطُّورَ خُذُوا۟ مَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَٱسْمَعُوا۟ ۖ قَالُوا۟ سَمِعْنَا وَعَصَيْنَا وَأُشْرِبُوا۟ فِى قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلْعِجْلَ بِكُفْرِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ بِئْسَمَا يَأْمُرُكُم بِهِۦٓ إِيمَـٰنُكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And when We took covenant with you and raised the Mount above you, [declaring], ‘Hold on with power to what We have given you, and do listen!’ They said, ‘We hear, and disobey,’ and their hearts had been imbued with [the love of] the Calf, due to their unfaith. Say, ‘Evil is that to which your faith prompts you, should you be faithful!’
rows.transliteration: wa idh akhadhnā mīthāqakum warafa`nā fawqakumuṭ ṭūra khudhū mā ātaynākum biquwwatin wasma`ū ۖ qālū sami`nā wa`aṣaynā wa-ushribū fī qulūbihimul `ijla bikufrihim ۚ qul bi-samā ya-murukum bihi-iymānukum in kuntum mu-minīn

rows.arabic: قُلْ إِن كَانَتْ لَكُمُ ٱلدَّارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَالِصَةً مِّن دُونِ ٱلنَّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا۟ ٱلْمَوْتَ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: Say, ‘If the abode of the Hereafter were exclusively for you with Allah, and not for other people, then long for death, should you be truthful.’
rows.transliteration: qul in kānat lakumud dārul-ākhiratu `indallāhi khāliṣatan min dūnin nāsi fatamannawul mawta in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: وَلَن يَتَمَنَّوْهُ أَبَدًۢا بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: But they will not long for it ever because of what their hands have sent ahead, and Allah knows best the wrongdoers.
rows.transliteration: walan yatamannawhu abadan bimā qaddamat aydīhim ۗ wallāhu `alīmun biẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَتَجِدَنَّهُمْ أَحْرَصَ ٱلنَّاسِ عَلَىٰ حَيَوٰةٍ وَمِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ ۚ يَوَدُّ أَحَدُهُمْ لَوْ يُعَمَّرُ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ وَمَا هُوَ بِمُزَحْزِحِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ أَن يُعَمَّرَ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِيرٌۢ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Surely, you will find them the greediest for life, of all people even the idolaters. Each of them is eager to live a thousand years, though it would not deliver him from the punishment, were he to live [that long]. And Allah watches what they do.
rows.transliteration: walatajidannahum aḥraṣan nāsi `alā ḥayātin wa minal ladhīna ashrakū ۚ yawaddu aḥaduhum law yu`ammaru alfa sanatin wa mā huwa bimuzaḥziḥihi minal `adhābi an yu`ammar ۗ wallāhu baṣīrun bimā ya`malūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَن كَانَ عَدُوًّا لِّجِبْرِيلَ فَإِنَّهُۥ نَزَّلَهُۥ عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَهُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Say, ‘Whoever is an enemy of Gabriel [should know that] it is he who has brought it down on your heart with the will of Allah, confirming what has been [revealed] before it and as a guidance and good news for the faithful.’
rows.transliteration: qul man kāna `aduwwal lijibrīla fa-innahu nazzalahu `alā qalbika bi-idhnillāhi muṣaddiqal limā bayna yadayhi wahudan wabushrā lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: مَن كَانَ عَدُوًّا لِّلَّهِ وَمَلَـٰٓئِكَتِهِۦ وَرُسُلِهِۦ وَجِبْرِيلَ وَمِيكَىٰلَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَدُوٌّ لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: [Say,] ‘Whoever is an enemy of Allah, His angels and His apostles and Gabriel and Michael, [let him know that] Allah is the enemy of the faithless.’
rows.transliteration: man kāna `aduwwal lillāhi wa malā-ikatihi warusulihi wajibrīla wa mīkāla fa-innallāha `aduwwul lilkāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ءَايَـٰتٍۭ بَيِّنَـٰتٍ ۖ وَمَا يَكْفُرُ بِهَآ إِلَّا ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
rows.translation: We have certainly sent down manifest signs to you, and no one denies them except transgressors.
rows.transliteration: walaqad anzalnā ilayka āyātin bayyināt ۖ wa mā yakfuru bihā illal-fāsiqūn

rows.arabic: أَوَكُلَّمَا عَـٰهَدُوا۟ عَهْدًا نَّبَذَهُۥ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Is it not that whenever they made a covenant, a part of them would cast it away? Rather, the majority of them do not have faith.
rows.transliteration: awakullamā `āhadū `ahdan nabadhahu farīqun minhum ۚ bal aktharuhum lā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ مُصَدِّقٌ لِّمَا مَعَهُمْ نَبَذَ فَرِيقٌ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ كِتَـٰبَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَآءَ ظُهُورِهِمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And when there came to them an apostle from Allah, confirming that which is with them, a part of those who were given the Book cast the Book of Allah behind their back, as if they did not know [that it is Allah’s Book].
rows.transliteration: walammā jā-ahum rasūlun min `indillāhi muṣaddiqul limā ma`ahum nabadha farīqun minal ladhīna ūtul kitāba kitāballāhi warā-a ẓuhūrihim ka-annahum lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَا تَتْلُوا۟ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ عَلَىٰ مُلْكِ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ ۖ وَمَا كَفَرَ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُعَلِّمُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ ٱلسِّحْرَ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَى ٱلْمَلَكَيْنِ بِبَابِلَ هَـٰرُوتَ وَمَـٰرُوتَ ۚ وَمَا يُعَلِّمَانِ مِنْ أَحَدٍ حَتَّىٰ يَقُولَآ إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ فِتْنَةٌ فَلَا تَكْفُرْ ۖ فَيَتَعَلَّمُونَ مِنْهُمَا مَا يُفَرِّقُونَ بِهِۦ بَيْنَ ٱلْمَرْءِ وَزَوْجِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا هُم بِضَآرِّينَ بِهِۦ مِنْ أَحَدٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَيَتَعَلَّمُونَ مَا يَضُرُّهُمْ وَلَا يَنفَعُهُمْ ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمُوا۟ لَمَنِ ٱشْتَرَىٰهُ مَا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مِنْ خَلَـٰقٍ ۚ وَلَبِئْسَ مَا شَرَوْا۟ بِهِۦٓ أَنفُسَهُمْ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And they followed what the devils pursued during Solomon’s reign —and Solomon was not faithless but it was the devils who were faithless—teaching the people magic and what was sent down to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut, who would not teach anyone without telling [him], ‘We are only a test, so do not be faithless.’ But they would learn from those two that with which they would cause a split between man and his wife—though they could not harm anyone with it except with Allah’s leave. They would learn that which would harm them and bring them no benefit; though they certainly knew that anyone who buys it has no share in the Hereafter. Surely, evil is that for which they sold their souls, had they known!
rows.transliteration: wattaba`ū mā tatlush shayāṭīnu `alā mulki sulaymān ۖ wa mā kafara sulaymānu walākinnash shayāṭīna kafarū yu`allimūnan nāsas siḥra wa mā unzila `alal-malakayni bibābila hārūta wa mārūt ۚ wa mā yu`allimāni min aḥadin ḥattā yaqūlā innamā naḥnu fitnatun falā takfur ۖ fayata`allamūna minhumā mā yufarriqūna bihi baynal mar-i wazawjih ۚ wa mā hum biḍārrīna bihi min aḥadin illā bi-idhnillāh ۚ wayata`allamūna mā yaḍurruhum walā yanfa`uhum ۚ walaqad `alimū lamanish-tarāhu mā lahu fil-ākhirati min khalāq ۚ walabi-sa mā sharaw bihi anfusahum ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّقَوْا۟ لَمَثُوبَةٌ مِّنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌ ۖ لَّوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Had they been faithful and Godwary, the reward from Allah would have been better, had they known!
rows.transliteration: walaw annahum āmanū wattaqaw lamathūbatun min `indillāhi khayr ۖ law kānū ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَقُولُوا۟ رَٰعِنَا وَقُولُوا۟ ٱنظُرْنَا وَٱسْمَعُوا۟ ۗ وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! Do not say Ra‘ina, but say Unzurna, and listen! And there is a painful punishment for the faithless.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū lā taqūlū rā`inā waqūlun-ẓurnā wasma`ū ۗ walilkāfirīna `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: مَّا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَلَا ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ أَن يُنَزَّلَ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَخْتَصُّ بِرَحْمَتِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: Neither the faithless from among the People of the Book nor the idolaters like that any good be showered on you from your Lord; but Allah singles out for His mercy whomever He wishes, and Allah is dispenser of a mighty grace.
rows.transliteration: mā yawaddul ladhīna kafarū min ahlil kitābi walal mushrikīna an yunazzala `alaykum min khayrin min rabbikum ۗ wallāhu yakhtaṣṣu biraḥmatihi man yashā-u ۚ wallāhu dhul faḍlil `aẓīm

rows.arabic: مَا نَنسَخْ مِنْ ءَايَةٍ أَوْ نُنسِهَا نَأْتِ بِخَيْرٍ مِّنْهَآ أَوْ مِثْلِهَآ ۗ أَلَمْ تَعْلَمْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: For any verse that We abrogate or cause to be forgotten, We bring another which is better than it, or similar to it. Do you not know that Allah has power over all things?
rows.transliteration: mā nansakh min āyatin aw nunsihā na-ti bikhayrin minhā aw mithlihā ۗ alam ta`lam annallāha `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَعْلَمْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
rows.translation: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? And besides Allah, you do not have any guardian or helper.
rows.transliteration: alam ta`lam annallāha lahu mulkus samāwāti wal-arḍ ۗ wa mā lakum min dūnillāhi min waliyyin walā naṣīr

rows.arabic: أَمْ تُرِيدُونَ أَن تَسْـَٔلُوا۟ رَسُولَكُمْ كَمَا سُئِلَ مُوسَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ ۗ وَمَن يَتَبَدَّلِ ٱلْكُفْرَ بِٱلْإِيمَـٰنِ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ
rows.translation: Would you question your Apostle as Moses was questioned formerly? Whoever changes faith for unfaith certainly strays from the right way.
rows.transliteration: am turīdūna an tas-alū rasūlakum kamā su-ila mūsā min qabl ۗ wa man yatabaddalil kufra bil-iymāni faqad ḍalla sawā-as sabīl

rows.arabic: وَدَّ كَثِيرٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَوْ يَرُدُّونَكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ إِيمَـٰنِكُمْ كُفَّارًا حَسَدًا مِّنْ عِندِ أَنفُسِهِم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ فَٱعْفُوا۟ وَٱصْفَحُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِىَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: Many of the People of the Book are eager to turn you into unbelievers after your faith, out of their inner envy, [and] after the truth had become manifest to them. Yet excuse [them] and forbear until Allah issues His edict. Indeed Allah has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: wadda kathīrun min ahlil kitābi law yaruddūnakum min ba`di-iymānikum kuffāran ḥasadan min `indi anfusihim min ba`di mā tabayyana lahumul ḥaqq ۖ fa`fū waṣfaḥū ḥattā ya-tiyallāhu bi-amrih ۗ innallāha `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
rows.translation: And maintain the prayer and give the zakat. Any good that you send ahead for your own souls, you shall find it with Allah. Indeed Allah watches what you do.
rows.transliteration: wa-aqīmuṣ ṣalāta wa-ātuz zakāh ۚ wa mā tuqaddimū li-anfusikum min khayrin tajidūhu `indallāh ۗ innallāha bimā ta`malūna baṣīr

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَن يَدْخُلَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ إِلَّا مَن كَانَ هُودًا أَوْ نَصَـٰرَىٰ ۗ تِلْكَ أَمَانِيُّهُمْ ۗ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: And they say, ‘No one will enter paradise except one who is a Jew or Christian.’ Those are their [false] hopes! Say, ‘Produce your evidence, should you be truthful.’
rows.transliteration: waqālū lan yadkhulal-jannata illā man kāna hūdan aw naṣārā ۗ tilka amāniyyuhum ۗ qul hātū burhānakum in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: بَلَىٰ مَنْ أَسْلَمَ وَجْهَهُۥ لِلَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحْسِنٌ فَلَهُۥٓ أَجْرُهُۥ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly, whoever submits his will to Allah and is virtuous, he shall have his reward from his Lord, and they will have no fear, nor shall they grieve.
rows.transliteration: balā man aslama wajhahu lillāhi wahuwa muḥsinun falahu ajruhu `inda rabbihi walā khawfun `alayhim walā hum yaḥzanūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَتِ ٱلْيَهُودُ لَيْسَتِ ٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍ وَقَالَتِ ٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ لَيْسَتِ ٱلْيَهُودُ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍ وَهُمْ يَتْلُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ مِثْلَ قَوْلِهِمْ ۚ فَٱللَّهُ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
rows.translation: The Jews say, ‘The Christians stand on nothing,’ and the Christians say, ‘The Jews stand on nothing,’ though they follow the [same] Book. So said those who had no knowledge, [words] similar to what they say. Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which they used to differ.
rows.transliteration: waqālatil yahūdu laysatin naṣārā `alā shay-in waqālatin naṣārā laysatil yahūdu `alā shay-in wahum yatlūnal kitāb ۗ kadhālika qālal ladhīna lā ya`lamūna mithla qawlihim ۚ fallāhu yaḥkumu baynahum yawmal qiyāmati fīmā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūn

rows.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن مَّنَعَ مَسَـٰجِدَ ٱللَّهِ أَن يُذْكَرَ فِيهَا ٱسْمُهُۥ وَسَعَىٰ فِى خَرَابِهَآ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ مَا كَانَ لَهُمْ أَن يَدْخُلُوهَآ إِلَّا خَآئِفِينَ ۚ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا خِزْىٌ وَلَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Who is a greater wrongdoer than those who deny access to the mosques of Allah lest His Name be celebrated therein, and try to ruin them? Such ones may not enter them, except in fear. There is disgrace for them in this world and a great punishment in the Hereafter.
rows.transliteration: wa man aẓlamu mimman mana`a masājidallāhi an yudhkara fīhas-muhu wasa`ā fī kharābihā ۚ ulā-ika mā kāna lahum an yadkhulūhā illā khā-ifīn ۚ lahum fid dunyā khizyun walahum fil-ākhirati `adhābun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَشْرِقُ وَٱلْمَغْرِبُ ۚ فَأَيْنَمَا تُوَلُّوا۟ فَثَمَّ وَجْهُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: To Allah belong the east and the west: so whichever way you turn, there is the face of Allah! Allah is indeed all-bounteous, all-knowing.
rows.transliteration: walillāhil mashriqu wal maghrib ۚ fa-aynamā tuwallū fathamma wajhullāh ۚ innallāha wāsi`un `alīm

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۖ بَل لَّهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ كُلٌّ لَّهُۥ قَـٰنِتُونَ
rows.translation: And they say, ‘Allah has taken a son.’ Immaculate is He! Rather, to Him belongs whatever there is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to Him,
rows.transliteration: waqālut-takhadhallāhu waladā ۗ subḥānah ۖ bal lahu mā fis samāwāti wal-arḍ ۖ kullul lahu qānitūn

rows.arabic: بَدِيعُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
rows.translation: the Originator of the heavens and the earth. When He decides on a matter, He just says to it, ‘Be!’ and it is.
rows.transliteration: badī`us samāwāti wal-arḍ ۖ wa idhā qaḍā amran fa-innamā yaqūlu lahu kun fayakūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ لَوْلَا يُكَلِّمُنَا ٱللَّهُ أَوْ تَأْتِينَآ ءَايَةٌ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّثْلَ قَوْلِهِمْ ۘ تَشَـٰبَهَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يُوقِنُونَ
rows.translation: Those who have no knowledge say, ‘Why does not Allah speak to us, or come to us a sign?’ So said those who were before them, [words] similar to what they say. Alike are their hearts. We have certainly made the signs clear for a people who have certainty.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna lā ya`lamūna lawlā yukallimunallāhu aw ta-tīnā āyah ۗ kadhālika qālal ladhīna min qablihim mithla qawlihim ۘ tashābahat qulūbuhum ۗ qad bayyannal-āyāti liqawmiy yūqinūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ بَشِيرًا وَنَذِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تُسْـَٔلُ عَنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: Indeed We have sent you with the truth, as a bearer of good news and as a warner, and you will not be questioned concerning the inmates of hell.
rows.transliteration: innā arsalnāka bil ḥaqqi bashīran wanadhīrā ۖ walā tus-alu `an aṣ-ḥābil jaḥīm

rows.arabic: وَلَن تَرْضَىٰ عَنكَ ٱلْيَهُودُ وَلَا ٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ تَتَّبِعَ مِلَّتَهُمْ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ هُوَ ٱلْهُدَىٰ ۗ وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَآءَهُم بَعْدَ ٱلَّذِى جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۙ مَا لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
rows.translation: Never will the Jews be pleased with you, nor the Christians, unless you followed their creed. Say, ‘Indeed it is the guidance of Allah which is [true] guidance.’ And should you follow their desires after the knowledge that has come to you, you will not have against Allah any guardian or helper.
rows.transliteration: walan tarḍā `ankal yahūdu walan naṣārā ḥattā tattabi`a millatahum ۗ qul inna hudallāhi huwal hudā ۗ wala-init-taba`ta ahwā-ahum ba`dal ladhī jā-aka minal `il-mi mā laka minallāhi min waliyyin walā naṣīr

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَتْلُونَهُۥ حَقَّ تِلَاوَتِهِۦٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۗ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: Those to whom We have given the Book follow it as it ought to be followed: they have faith in it. As for those who deny it—it is they who are the losers.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna ātaynāhumul kitāba yatlūnahu ḥaqqa tilāwatihi ulā-ika yu-minūna bih ۗ wa man yakfur bihi fa-ulā-ika humul khāsirūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتِىَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَأَنِّى فَضَّلْتُكُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: O Children of Israel, remember My blessing which I bestowed upon you, and that I gave you an advantage over all the nations.
rows.transliteration: yābanī isrā-iyladh-kurū ni`matiyal latī an`amtu `alaykum wa-annī faḍḍaltukum `alal-`ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ يَوْمًا لَّا تَجْزِى نَفْسٌ عَن نَّفْسٍ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا يُقْبَلُ مِنْهَا عَدْلٌ وَلَا تَنفَعُهَا شَفَـٰعَةٌ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
rows.translation: Beware of the Day when no soul will compensate for another, neither will any ransom be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be helped.
rows.transliteration: wattaqū yawmal lā tajzī nafsun `an nafsin shay-an walā yuqbalu minhā `adlun walā tanfa`uhā shafā`atun walā hum yunṣarūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذِ ٱبْتَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ رَبُّهُۥ بِكَلِمَـٰتٍ فَأَتَمَّهُنَّ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّى جَاعِلُكَ لِلنَّاسِ إِمَامًا ۖ قَالَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِى ۖ قَالَ لَا يَنَالُ عَهْدِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: When his Lord tested Abraham with certain words and he fulfilled them, He said, ‘I am making you the Imam of mankind.’ Said he, ‘And from among my descendants?’ He said, ‘My pledge does not extend to the unjust.’
rows.transliteration: wa idhib-talā ibrāh-yma rabbuhu bikalimātin fa-atammahunn ۖ qāla innī jā`iluka linnāsi imāmā ۖ qāla wa min dhurriyyatī ۖ qāla lā yanālu `ahdiẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ جَعَلْنَا ٱلْبَيْتَ مَثَابَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَمْنًا وَٱتَّخِذُوا۟ مِن مَّقَامِ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ مُصَلًّى ۖ وَعَهِدْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ أَن طَهِّرَا بَيْتِىَ لِلطَّآئِفِينَ وَٱلْعَـٰكِفِينَ وَٱلرُّكَّعِ ٱلسُّجُودِ
rows.translation: And [remember] when We made the House a place of reward for mankind and a sanctuary, [declaring], ‘Take the venue of prayer from Abraham’s Station.’ We charged Abraham and Ishmael [with its upkeep, saying], ‘Purify My House for those who go around it, [for] those who make it a retreat and [for] those who bow and prostrate.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh ja`alnal bayta mathābatan linnāsi wa-amnan wattakhidhū min maqāmi ibrāh-yma muṣallā ۖ wa`ahidnā ilā ibrāh-yma wa ismā`īla an ṭahhirā baytiya liṭṭā-ifīna wal `ākifīna war rukka`is sujūd

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْ هَـٰذَا بَلَدًا ءَامِنًا وَٱرْزُقْ أَهْلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ مَنْ ءَامَنَ مِنْهُم بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ ۖ قَالَ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَأُمَتِّعُهُۥ قَلِيلًا ثُمَّ أَضْطَرُّهُۥٓ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
rows.translation: And when Abraham said, ‘My Lord, make this a secure town, and provide its people with fruits—such of them as have faith in Allah and the Last Day,’ He said, ‘As for him who is faithless, I will provide for him [too] for a short time, then I will shove him toward the punishment of the Fire and it is an evil destination.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla ibrāh-ymu rabbij-`al hādhā baladan āminan warzuq ahlahu minath thamarāti man āmana minhum billāhi wal yawmil-ākhir ۖ qāla wa man kafara fa-umatti`uhu qalīlan thumma aḍṭarruhu ilā `adhābin nār ۖ wabi-sal maṣīr

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ يَرْفَعُ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ ٱلْقَوَاعِدَ مِنَ ٱلْبَيْتِ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلُ رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: As Abraham raised the foundations of the House with Ishmael, [they prayed]: ‘Our Lord, accept it from us! Indeed You are the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
rows.transliteration: wa idh yarfa`u ibrāh-ymul qawā`ida minal bayti wa ismā`īlu rabbanā taqabbal minnā ۖ innaka antas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: رَبَّنَا وَٱجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَيْنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَآ أُمَّةً مُّسْلِمَةً لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
rows.translation: ‘Our Lord, make us submissive to You, and [raise] from our progeny a nation submissive to You, and show us our rites [of worship], and turn to us clemently. Indeed You are the All-clement, the All-merciful.’
rows.transliteration: rabbanā waj`alnā muslimayni laka wa min dhurriyyatinā ummatan muslimatan laka wa-arinā manāsikanā watub `alaynā ۖ innaka antat tawwābur raḥīm

rows.arabic: رَبَّنَا وَٱبْعَثْ فِيهِمْ رَسُولًا مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتِكَ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: ‘Our Lord, raise amongst them an apostle from among them, who will recite to them Your signs and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed You are the All-mighty, the All-wise.’
rows.transliteration: rabbanā wab`ath fīhim rasūlan minhum yatlū `alayhim āyātika wayu`allimuhumul kitāba wal ḥikmata wayuzakkīhim ۚ innaka antal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَمَن يَرْغَبُ عَن مِّلَّةِ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ إِلَّا مَن سَفِهَ نَفْسَهُۥ ۚ وَلَقَدِ ٱصْطَفَيْنَـٰهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: And who will [ever] forsake Abraham’s creed except one who debases himself? We certainly chose him in the [present] world, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the Righteous.
rows.transliteration: wa man yarghabu `an millati ibrāh-yma illā man safiha nafsah ۚ walaqadiṣ-ṭafaynāhu fid dunyā ۖ wa innahu fil-ākhirati laminaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥٓ أَسْلِمْ ۖ قَالَ أَسْلَمْتُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: When his Lord said to him, ‘Submit,’ he said, ‘I submit to the Lord of all the worlds.’
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahu rabbuhu aslim ۖ qāla aslamtu lirabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَوَصَّىٰ بِهَآ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ بَنِيهِ وَيَعْقُوبُ يَـٰبَنِىَّ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصْطَفَىٰ لَكُمُ ٱلدِّينَ فَلَا تَمُوتُنَّ إِلَّا وَأَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Abraham enjoined this [creed] upon his children, and [so did] Jacob, [saying], ‘My children! Allah has indeed chosen this religion for you; so do not die except as those who have surrendered themselves [to Allah].
rows.transliteration: wawaṣṣā bihā ibrāh-ymu banīhi waya`qūbu yābaniyya innallāhaṣ-ṭafā lakumud dīna falā tamūtunna illā wa-antum muslimūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ كُنتُمْ شُهَدَآءَ إِذْ حَضَرَ يَعْقُوبَ ٱلْمَوْتُ إِذْ قَالَ لِبَنِيهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنۢ بَعْدِى قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ إِلَـٰهَكَ وَإِلَـٰهَ ءَابَآئِكَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ إِلَـٰهًا وَٰحِدًا وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his children, ‘What will you worship after me?’ They said, ‘We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac, the One God, and to Him do we submit.’
rows.transliteration: am kuntum shuhadā-a idh ḥaḍara ya`qūbal mawtu idh qāla libanīhi mā ta`budūna min ba`dī qālū na`budu ilāhaka wa ilāha ābā-ika ibrāh-yma wa ismā`īla wa is-ḥāqa ilāhan wāḥidan wanaḥnu lahu muslimūn

rows.arabic: تِلْكَ أُمَّةٌ قَدْ خَلَتْ ۖ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَلَكُم مَّا كَسَبْتُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُسْـَٔلُونَ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: That was a nation that has passed: for it there will be what it has earned, and for you there will be what you have earned, and you will not be questioned about what they used to do.
rows.transliteration: tilka ummatun qad khalat ۖ lahā mā kasabat walakum mā kasabtum ۖ walā tus-alūna `ammā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ كُونُوا۟ هُودًا أَوْ نَصَـٰرَىٰ تَهْتَدُوا۟ ۗ قُلْ بَلْ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ حَنِيفًا ۖ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: They say, ‘Be either Jews or Christians, that you may be [rightly] guided.’ Say, ‘No, rather, [we will follow] the creed of Abraham, a Hanif, and he was not one of the polytheists.’
rows.transliteration: waqālū kūnū hūdan aw naṣārā tahtadū ۗ qul bal millata ibrāh-yma ḥanīfā ۖ wa mā kāna minal mushrikīn

rows.arabic: قُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْنَا وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَٱلْأَسْبَاطِ وَمَآ أُوتِىَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَمَآ أُوتِىَ ٱلنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّنْهُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Say, ‘We have faith in Allah and what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, and that which Moses and Jesus were given, and that which the prophets were given from their Lord; we make no distinction between any of them and to Him do we submit.’
rows.transliteration: qūlū āmannā billāhi wa mā unzila ilaynā wa mā unzila ilā ibrāh-yma wa ismā`īla wa is-ḥāqa waya`qūba wal-asbāṭi wa mā ūtiya mūsā wa`īsā wa mā ūtiyan nabiyyūna min rabbihim lā nufarriqu bayna aḥadin minhum wanaḥnu lahu muslimūn

rows.arabic: فَإِنْ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِمِثْلِ مَآ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ فَقَدِ ٱهْتَدَوا۟ ۖ وَّإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّمَا هُمْ فِى شِقَاقٍ ۖ فَسَيَكْفِيكَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: So if they believe in the like of what you believe in, then they are surely guided; but if they turn away, then [know that] they are only [steeped] in defiance. Allah will suffice you against them, and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
rows.transliteration: fa-in āmanū bimithli mā āmantum bihi faqadih-tadaw ۖ wa in tawallaw fa-innamā hum fī shiqāq ۖ fasayakfīkahumullāh ۚ wahuwas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: صِبْغَةَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَمَنْ أَحْسَنُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ صِبْغَةً ۖ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ عَـٰبِدُونَ
rows.translation: ‘The baptism of Allah, and who baptizes better than Allah? And Him do we worship.’
rows.transliteration: ṣibghatallāh ۖ wa man aḥsanu minallāhi ṣibghah ۖ wanaḥnu lahu `ābidūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ أَتُحَآجُّونَنَا فِى ٱللَّهِ وَهُوَ رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّكُمْ وَلَنَآ أَعْمَـٰلُنَا وَلَكُمْ أَعْمَـٰلُكُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُخْلِصُونَ
rows.translation: Say, ‘Will you argue with us concerning Allah, while He is our Lord and your Lord, and to us belong our deeds, and to you belong your deeds, and we worship Him dedicatedly?’
rows.transliteration: qul atuḥājjūnanā fillāhi wahuwa rabbunā warabbukum walanā a`mālunā walakum a`mālukum wanaḥnu lahu mukhliṣūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ تَقُولُونَ إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَٱلْأَسْبَاطَ كَانُوا۟ هُودًا أَوْ نَصَـٰرَىٰ ۗ قُلْ ءَأَنتُمْ أَعْلَمُ أَمِ ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن كَتَمَ شَهَـٰدَةً عِندَهُۥ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: [Ask them,] ‘Do you say that Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes were Jews or Christians?’ Say, ‘Is it you who know better, or Allah?’ And who is a greater wrongdoer than someone who conceals a testimony that is with him from Allah? And Allah is not oblivious of what you do.
rows.transliteration: am taqūlūna inna ibrāh-yma wa ismā`īla wa is-ḥāqa waya`qūba wal-asbāṭa kānū hūdan aw naṣārā ۗ qul a-antum a`lamu amillāh ۗ wa man aẓlamu mimman katama shahādatan `indahu minallāh ۗ wa mallāhu bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn

rows.arabic: تِلْكَ أُمَّةٌ قَدْ خَلَتْ ۖ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَلَكُم مَّا كَسَبْتُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُسْـَٔلُونَ عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: That was a nation that has passed: for it there will be what it has earned, and for you there will be what you have earned, and you will not be questioned about what they used to do.
rows.transliteration: tilka ummatun qad khalat ۖ lahā mā kasabat walakum mā kasabtum ۖ walā tus-alūna `ammā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: سَيَقُولُ ٱلسُّفَهَآءُ مِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَا وَلَّىٰهُمْ عَن قِبْلَتِهِمُ ٱلَّتِى كَانُوا۟ عَلَيْهَا ۚ قُل لِّلَّهِ ٱلْمَشْرِقُ وَٱلْمَغْرِبُ ۚ يَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
rows.translation: The foolish among the people will say, ‘What has turned them away from the qiblah they were following?’ Say, ‘To Allah belong the east and the west. He guides whomever He wishes to a straight path.’
rows.transliteration: sayaqūlus sufahā-u minan nāsi mā wallāhum `an qiblatihimul latī kānū `alayhā ۚ qul lillāhil mashriqu wal maghrib ۚ yahdī man yashā-u ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَـٰكُمْ أُمَّةً وَسَطًا لِّتَكُونُوا۟ شُهَدَآءَ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَيَكُونَ ٱلرَّسُولُ عَلَيْكُمْ شَهِيدًا ۗ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا ٱلْقِبْلَةَ ٱلَّتِى كُنتَ عَلَيْهَآ إِلَّا لِنَعْلَمَ مَن يَتَّبِعُ ٱلرَّسُولَ مِمَّن يَنقَلِبُ عَلَىٰ عَقِبَيْهِ ۚ وَإِن كَانَتْ لَكَبِيرَةً إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ هَدَى ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُضِيعَ إِيمَـٰنَكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِٱلنَّاسِ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Thus We have made you a middle nation that you may be witnesses to the people, and that the Apostle may be a witness to you. We did not appoint the qiblah you were following, but that We may ascertain those who follow the Apostle from those who turn back on their heels. It was indeed a hard thing except for those whom Allah has guided. And Allah would not let your prayers go to waste. Indeed Allah is most kind and merciful to mankind.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika ja`alnākum ummatan wasaṭal litakūnū shuhadā-a `alan nāsi wayakūnar rasūlu `alaykum shahīdā ۗ wa mā ja`alnal qiblatal latī kunta `alayhā illā lina`lama man yattabi`ur rasūla mimman yanqalibu `alā `aqibayh ۚ wa in kānat lakabīratan illā `alal ladhīna hadallāh ۗ wa mā kānallāhu liyuḍī`a-iymānakum ۚ innallāha bin nāsi lara-ūfun raḥīm

rows.arabic: قَدْ نَرَىٰ تَقَلُّبَ وَجْهِكَ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ ۖ فَلَنُوَلِّيَنَّكَ قِبْلَةً تَرْضَىٰهَا ۚ فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ۚ وَحَيْثُ مَا كُنتُمْ فَوَلُّوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ شَطْرَهُۥ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ لَيَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّهُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: We certainly see you turning your face about in the sky. We will surely turn you to a qiblah of your liking: so turn your face towards the Holy Mosque, and wherever you may be, turn your faces towards it! Indeed those who were given the Book surely know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not oblivious of what they do.
rows.transliteration: qad narā taqalluba wajhika fis samā-i ۖ falanuwalliyannaka qiblatan tarḍāhā ۚ fawalli wajhaka shaṭral masjidil ḥarām ۚ waḥaythu mā kuntum fawallū wujūhakum shaṭrah ۗ wa innal ladhīna ūtul kitāba laya`lamūna annahul ḥaqqu min rabbihim ۗ wa mallāhu bighāfilin `ammā ya`malūn

rows.arabic: وَلَئِنْ أَتَيْتَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِكُلِّ ءَايَةٍ مَّا تَبِعُوا۟ قِبْلَتَكَ ۚ وَمَآ أَنتَ بِتَابِعٍ قِبْلَتَهُمْ ۚ وَمَا بَعْضُهُم بِتَابِعٍ قِبْلَةَ بَعْضٍ ۚ وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَآءَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۙ إِنَّكَ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: Even if you bring those who were given the Book every [kind of] sign, they will not follow your qiblah. Nor shall you follow their qiblah, nor will any of them follow the qiblah of the other. And if you follow their desires, after the knowledge that has come to you, you will be one of the wrongdoers.
rows.transliteration: wala-in ataytal ladhīna ūtul kitāba bikulli āyatim mā tabi`ū qiblatak ۚ wa mā anta bitābi`in qiblatahum ۚ wa mā ba`ḍuhum bitābi`in qiblata ba`ḍ ۚ wala-init-taba`ta ahwā-ahum min ba`di mā jā-aka minal `il-mi innaka idhal laminaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَعْرِفُونَهُۥ كَمَا يَعْرِفُونَ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ ۖ وَإِنَّ فَرِيقًا مِّنْهُمْ لَيَكْتُمُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Those whom We have given the Book recognize him just as they recognize their sons, but a part of them indeed conceal the truth while they know.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna ātaynāhumul kitāba ya`rifūnahu kamā ya`rifūna abnā-ahum ۖ wa inna farīqan minhum layaktumūnal ḥaqqa wahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ ۖ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُمْتَرِينَ
rows.translation: This is the truth from your Lord; so do not be among the skeptics.
rows.transliteration: al-ḥaqqu min rabbik ۖ falā takūnanna minal mumtarīn
